The List Of API Signals I Track On In My API Stack Research

I keep an eye on several thousand companies as part of my research into the API spaceÂ and publish over a thousand of these profiles in my API Stack project. Across the over 1,100 companies, organizations, institutions, and government agencies Iâ€™m regularly runningÂ into a growing number of signals that tune me into what is going on with each API provider, or service provider.Â 

Here are the almost 100 types of signals I am tuning into as I keep an eye on the world of APIs, each contributing to my unique awareness of what is going on with everything API.

  • Account SettingsÂ (x-account-settings) - Does an API provider allow me to manage the settings for my account?
  • Android SDKÂ (x-android-sdk) - Is there an Android SDK present?
  • AngularÂ (x-angularjs)Â - Is there an Angular SDK present?
  • API ExplorerÂ (x-api-explorer) - Does a provider have an interactive API explorer?
  • Application GalleryÂ (x-application-gallery) - Is there a gallery of applications build on an API available?
  • Application ManagerÂ (x-application-manager) - Does the platform allow me to management my APIs?
  • Authentication OverviewÂ (x-authentication-overview) - Is there a page dedicated to educating users about authentication?
  • Base URL for APIÂ (x-base-url-for-api) - What is the base URL(s) for the API?
  • Base **URL for Portal**Â (x-base-url-for-portal) - What is the base URL for the developer portal?
  • Best PracticesÂ (x-best-practices) - Is there a page outlining best practices for integrating with an API?
  • Billing historyÂ (x-billing-history) - As a developer, can I get at the billing history for my API consumption?
  • BlogÂ (x-blog) - Does the API have a blog, either at the company level, but preferably at the API and developer level as well?
  • Blog RSS FeedÂ (x-blog-rss-feed) - Is there an RSS feed for the blog?
  • Branding pageÂ (x-branding-page) - Is there a dedicated branding page as part of API operations?
  • ButtonsÂ (x-buttons) - Are there any embeddable buttons available as part of API operations.
  • C# SDKÂ (x-c-sharp) -Â Is there a C# SDK present?
  • Case StudiesÂ (x-case-studies) - Are there case studies available, showcasing implementations on top of an API?
  • Change LogÂ (x-change-log) - Does a platform provide a change log?
  • Chrome ExtensionÂ (x-chrome-extension) - Does a platform offer up open-source or white label chrome extensions?
  • Code builderÂ (x-code-builder) - Is there some sort of code generator or builder as part of platform operations?
  • Code pageÂ (x-code-page) - Is there a dedicated code page for all the samples, libraries, and SDKs?
  • Command Line InterfaceÂ (x-command-line-interface) - Is there a command line interface (CLI) alongside the API?
  • Community Supported LibrariesÂ (x-community-supported-libraries) - Is there a page or section dedicated to code that is developed by the API and developer community?
  • ComplianceÂ (x-compliance) - Is there a section dedicated to industry compliance?
  • Contact formÂ (x-contact-form) - Is there a contact form for getting in touch?
  • CrunchbaseÂ (x-crunchbase) - Is there a Crunchbase profile for an API or its company?
  • Dedicated plans pricing pageÂ (x-dedicated-plansâ€“pricing-page)
  • Deprecation policyÂ (x-deprecation-policy) - Is there a page dedicated to deprecation of APIs?
  • Developer ShowcaseÂ (xâ€“developer-showcase) - Is there a page that showcases API developers?
  • DocumentationÂ (x-documentation) - Where is the documentation for an API?
  • DrupalÂ (x-drupal) - Is there Drupal code, SDK, or modules available for an API?
  • EmailÂ (x-email) - Is an email address available for a platform?
  • Embeddable pageÂ (x-embeddable-page) - Is there a page of embeddable tools available for a platform?
  • Error response codesÂ (x-error-response-codes) - Is there a listing or page dedicated to API error responses?
  • EventsÂ (x-events) - Is there a calendar of events related to platform operations?
  • FacebookÂ (x-facebook) - Is there a Facebook page available for an API?
  • FaqÂ (x-faq) - Is there an FAQ section available for the platform?
  • ForumÂ (x-forum) - Does a provider have a forum for support and asynchronous conversations?
  • Forum rssÂ (x-forum-rss) - If there is a forum, does it have an RSS feed?
  • Getting startedÂ (x-getting-started) - Is there a getting started page for an API?
  • GithubÂ (x-github) - Does a provider have a Github account for the API or company?
  • GlossaryÂ (x-glossary) - Is there a glossary of terms available for a platform?
  • HerokuÂ (x-heroku) - Are there Heroku SDKs, or deployment solutions?
  • How-To GuidesÂ (x-howto-guides) - Does a provider offer how-to guides as part of operations?
  • Interactive documentationÂ (x-interactive-documentation) - Is there interactive documentation available as part of operatoins?
  • IoS SDKÂ (x-ios-sdk) - Is there an IoS SDK for Objective-C or Swift?
  • IssuesÂ (x-issues) - Is there an issue management page or repo for the platform?
  • JavaÂ SDK (x-java) - Is there a Java SDK for the platform?
  • JavaScript APIÂ (x-javascript-api) - Is there a JavaScript SDK available for a platform?
  • JoomlaÂ (x-joomla) - Is there Joomla plug for the platform?
  • KnowledgebaseÂ (x-knowledgebase) - Is there a knowledgebase for the platform?
  • LabsÂ (x-labs) - Is there a labs environment for the API platform?
  • Licensing (x-licensing) - Is there licensing for the API, schema, and code involved?
  • Message CenterÂ (x-message-center) - Is there a messaging center available for developers?
  • Mobile OverviewÂ (x-mobile-overview) - Is there a section or page dedicated to mobile applications?
  • Node.jsÂ (x-nodejs) - Is there a Node.js SDK available for the API?
  • Oauth ScopesÂ (x-oauth-scopes) - Does a provider offer details on the available OAuth scopes?
  • Openapi specÂ (x-openapi-spec) - Is there an OpenAPI available for the API?
  • OverviewÂ (x-overview) - Does a platform have a simple, concise description of what they do?
  • Paid support plansÂ (x-paid-support-plans) - Are there paid support plans available for a platform?
  • Postman Collections (x-postman) - Are there any Postman Collections available?
  • PartnerÂ (x-partner) - Is there a partner program available as part of API operations?
  • PhoneÂ (x-phone) - Does a provider publish a phone number?
  • PHP SDKÂ (x-php) - Is there a PHP SDK available for an API?
  • Privacy PolicyÂ (x-privacy-policy-page) - Does a platform have a privacy policy?
  • PubSubÂ (x-pubsubhubbub) - Does a platform provide a PubSub feed?
  • Python SDKÂ (x-python) - Is there a Python SDK for an API?
  • Rate LimitingÂ (x-rate-limiting) - Does a platform provide information on API rate limiting?
  • Real Time SolutionsÂ (x-real-time-page) - Are there real-time solutions available as part of the platform?
  • Road MapÂ (x-road-map) - Does a provider share their roadmap publicly?
  • Ruby SDKÂ (x-ruby) - Is there a Ruby SDK available for the API?
  • SandboxÂ (x-sandbox) - Is there a sandbox for the platform?
  • SecurityÂ (x-security) - Does a platform provide an overview of security practices?
  • Self-Service registrationÂ (x-self-service-registration) - Does a platform allow for self-service registration?
  • Service Level AgreementÂ (x-service-level-agreement) - Is an SLA available as part of platform integration?
  • SlideshareÂ (x-slideshare) - Does a provider publish talks on Slideshare?
  • Stack OverflowÂ (x-stack-overflow) - Does a provider actively use Stack Overflow as part of platform operations?
  • Starter ProjectsÂ (x-starter-projects) - Are there start projects available as part of platform operations?
  • Status DashboardÂ (x-status-dashboard) - Is there a status dashboard available as part of API operations.
  • Status HistoryÂ (x-status-history) - Can you get at the history involved with API operations?
  • Status RSSÂ (x-status-rss) - Is there an RSS feed available as part of the platform status dashboard?
  • Support PageÂ (x-support-overview-page) - Is there a page or section dedicated to support?
  • Terms of ServiceÂ (x-terms-of-service-page) - Is there a terms of service page?
  • Ticket SystemÂ (x-ticket-system) - Does a platform offer a ticketing system for support?
  • TourÂ (x-tour) - Is a tour available to walk a developer through platforms operations?
  • TrademarksÂ (x-trademarks) - Is there details about trademarks, and how to use them?
  • TwitterÂ (x-twitter) - Does a platform have a Twitter account dedicated to the API or even company?
  • VideosÂ (x-videos) - Is there a page, YouTube, or other account dedicated to videos about the API?
  • WebhooksÂ (x-webhook) - Are there webhooks available for an API?
  • WebinarsÂ (x-webinars) - Does an API conduct webinars to support operations?
  • White papersÂ (x-white-papers) - Does a platform provide white papers as part of operations?
  • WidgetsÂ (x-widgets) - Are there widgets available for use as part of integration?
  • WordpressÂ (x-wordpress) - Are there WordPress plugins or code available?

There are hundreds of other building blocks I track on as part of API operations, but this list represents the most common, that often have dedicated URLs available for exploring, and have the most significant impact on API integrations. Youâ€™ll notice there is an x- representation for each one, which I use as part of APIs.json indexes for all the APIs I track on. Some of these signal types are machine readable like OpenAPIs or a Blog RSS, with others machine readable because there is another API behind, like Twitter or Github, but most of them are just static pages, where a human (me) can visit and stay in tune with signals.

I have two primary objectives with this work: 1) identify the important signals, that impact integration, and will keep me and my readers in tune with what is going on, and 2) identify the common channels, and help move the more important ones to be machine-readable, allowing us to scale the monitoring of important signals like pricing and terms of service. My API Stack research provides me wit a nice listing of APIs, as well as more individualized stacks like Microsoft, Google, Microsoft, and Facebook, or even industry stacks like SMS, Email, and News. It also provides me with a wealth of signals we can tune into better understand the scope and health of the API sector, and any individual business vertical that is being touched by APIs.
